Knowledge manages the linguistic information for Japanese morphological analysis. More...

Detailed Description

Knowledge manages the linguistic information for Japanese morphological analysis.

enum jma::Knowledge::EncodeType

Encode type of characters.

Enumerator:
ENCODE_TYPE_EUCJP 

EUC-JP character type.

ENCODE_TYPE_SJIS 

SHIFT-JIS character type.

ENCODE_TYPE_UTF8 

UTF-8 character type.

ENCODE_TYPE_NUM 

the count of character types

Member Function Documentation

void jma::Knowledge::addUserDict ( const char *  fileName,
EncodeType  type = ENCODE_TYPE_UTF8 
)

Add the user dictionary file, which is in text format, the source encoding type of user dictionary file is also given in parameter, which is UTF-8 by default, this function could be called more than once, so that multiple user dictionaries could be added.

Parameters:
fileName the file path of user dictionary
type the source encoding type of user dictionary, UTF-8 is assumed if omitted

virtual int jma::Knowledge::encodeSystemDict ( const char *  txtDirPath,
const char *  binDirPath,
EncodeType  binEncodeType 
) [pure virtual]

Encode the system dictionary files from text to binary file.

Parameters:
txtDirPath the directory path of text files
binDirPath the directory path of binary files
binEncodeType the encoding type of binary system dictionary
Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success
Precondition:
both txtDirPath and binDirPath are assumed as the directory paths that already exists. If any of the directory paths does not exist, 0 would be returned for fail.

virtual int jma::Knowledge::loadDict (  )  [pure virtual]

Load the dictionaries, which are set by setSystemDict() and addUserDict().

Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success
Precondition:
the directory path of system dictionary should be set by setSystemDict().
if any user dictionary file need to be loaded, the file name should be added by addUserDict().

Implemented in jma::JMA_Knowledge.

Referenced by main().

virtual int jma::Knowledge::loadStopWordDict ( const char *  fileName  )  [pure virtual]

Load the stop-word dictionary file, which is in text format.

The words in this file are ignored in the morphological analysis result.

Parameters:
fileName the file name
Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success
Attention:
The encoding type of this file should be the same to the encoding type of system dictioanry loaded.

Implemented in jma::JMA_Knowledge.

Referenced by main().

virtual int jma::Knowledge::setKeywordPOS ( const std::vector< std::string > &  posVec  )  [pure virtual]

Set the part-of-speech tags as keywords.

If this method is not called or posVec is empty, the results of Analyzer::runWith*() would contain all words. Otherwise, if posVec is not empty, the results of Analyzer::runWith*() would only contain the words with part-of-speech tags specified by this method.

Parameters:
posVec the vector of part-of-speech tags in alphabet format, such as "NC-G"
Returns:
the number of part-of-speech tags successfully set
Attention:
This method should be called after loadDict(), otherwise no keyword part-of-speech tag would be set

Implemented in jma::JMA_Knowledge.

Referenced by main().

Parameters:
dirPath the directory path
